quest.tech.intro.title: Introduction To Technology
quest.tech.intro.subtitle: Time to get your thinking hats on.
quest.tech.intro.description_1: Many of the more advanced materials in this modpack can be manufactured instead of looted.
quest.tech.intro.description_2: To do so will require the use of two tech mods, Create and Immersive engineering.
quest.tech.intro.description_3: While this guidebook will walk you though the basics, it is recommended to use either the in-game guides for the respective mods, or learn it elsewhere.
quest.tech.treated.create.title: Create Engineering
quest.tech.treated.create.subtitle: Getting stressed...
quest.tech.treated.create.description_1: Create is used in all stages of progression, especially mid-tier items and equipment, as well as for ammo production.
quest.tech.treated.create.description_2: The simplest way to understand how create machines work is to hover your cursor over the item and hold [W] to ponder.
quest.tech.treated.mechanical_crafter.de: You should aim to set up at least a mechanical crafting system past the mid-tier, as it is used for many recipies.
Mechanical crafters can be looted in the city, or crafted. Remember to use [W] to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.engineer.title: Immersive Engineering
quest.tech.treated.engineer.subtitle: You get a multiblock, and you get a multiblock...
quest.tech.treated.engineer.description_: Immersive Engineering is crucial in creating and automating late game materials.
It is recommended you consult their manual if you're ever stuck about how to use a machine.
quest.tech.treated.schematic.title: Schematic Table
quest.tech.treated.schematic.subtitle: A Holographic Guide
quest.tech.treated.schematic.description: The schematic table allows you to display multiblock buildings layer by layer - as well as showing where you may have placed or used incorrect blocks.
Place paper into the slot and select the building you want to make.
Once you've made the schematic, hold Shift + Right Click on the ground to mark the location you want to build. After that, placing the schematic on your offhand will show a hologram of the structure.
quest.tech.treated.andesite.title: Andesite Alloy
quest.tech.treated.andesite.subtitle: Starting With Create
quest.tech.treated.andesite.description_: Andesite Alloy is the base material for most Create contraptions.
It is crafted from andesite and iron or zinc nuggets.
While it is possible to automate andesite production using lava, gravel and flint, looting buildings for create components may be faster.
quest.tech.treated.shaft.title: Shafts
quest.tech.treated.shaft.description_1: Shafts allow for power to be transferred in a straight line.
quest.tech.treated.shaft.description_2: Remember to use [W] to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.cogwheel.title: Cogwheels
quest.tech.treated.cogwheel.description_: Cogwheels allow transferring power to adjacent cogwheels.
Remember to use [W] to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.crank.title: Hand Crank
quest.tech.treated.crank.description_1: The hand crank is the most basic power source for Create. It is very weak, but should allow you to run the simplest machines.
quest.tech.treated.crank.description_2: For better power sources, we recommend checking out the Power Generation section in the questbook.
quest.tech.treated.crank.description_3: Remember to use [W] to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.gearbox.title: Gearboxes
quest.tech.treated.gearbox.description_1: Gearboxes allow power to change directions.
quest.tech.treated.gearbox.description_2: Remember to use [W] to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.learning.title: Create Mastery
quest.tech.treated.learning.subtitle: So much potential, so little time...
quest.tech.treated.learning.description_: There are many things you can automate with Create alone, but we cannot go through them all here.
If you're interested in learning more, you can find Create items on EMI using the keyword @create and ponder them using [W], or check out guides online.
Some useful things to set up from here on are a power generation source, as well as mechanical crafting.
quest.tech.treated.goldplate.title: Gold Plate
quest.tech.treated.goldplate.description: You can get gold plates by looting, or by using the Engineer's Hammer from Immersive Engineering on a gold ingot.
quest.tech.treated.wrench.title: Wrench
quest.tech.treated.wrench.description_1: The Wrench is a very useful tool for rotating and dismantling Create mechanisms. It is recommended you get one as soon as possible if you plan to build a lot of Create devices.
quest.tech.treated.sandstone.title: Sandstone
quest.tech.treated.sandstone.subtitle: Compress sand into sandstone.
quest.tech.treated.sandstone.description: Alternatively, find sandstone from deserts, or grind gravel into sand using Create.
quest.tech.treated.engineers_hammer.desc: The Engineer's Hammer allows you to turn ingots into plates, which are used for many Immersive Engineering recipes.
It also is the final step in assembling multiblock machines.
The Engineer's Wire Cutters allows you to turn plates into wires. Copper wire spools are a cheap way to transfer energy between machines.
quest.tech.treated.clay.title: Clay
quest.tech.treated.clay.description_1: Clay deposits can be found near rivers and in oceans.
quest.tech.treated.brick.description_1: Some clay will need to be smelted to become bricks. Make sure to keep enough, as the coke brick recipe uses them in a 1:1 ratio.
quest.tech.treated.coke_brick.descriptio: Craft a coke brick using clay, bricks, and sandstone.
quest.tech.treated.coke_oven.title: Coke Oven
quest.tech.treated.coke_oven.description: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a coke oven under [Workbenches And Furnaces > Coke Oven]
quest.tech.treated.creosote.description_: Burn logs, coal or charcoal to obtain creosote oil.
You can take it out using a bucket.
quest.tech.treated.torch_production.desc: One of the new recipes added by this modpack lets you craft torches in bulk using creosote and wool.
See if you can find it!
quest.tech.treated.planks.subtitle: Wood you look at that...
quest.tech.treated.planks.description_1: Craft treated wood planks by combining planks with creosote oil.
quest.tech.treated.planks.description_2: Treated wood forms the basis for MANY Immersive Engineering machines. Be sure to check what can be crafted using it!
quest.tech.treated.coal_coke.subtitle: The fuel of the future
quest.tech.treated.coal_coke.description: A byproduct of the production of creosote oil is coal coke, which is an excellent fuel.
It is highly recommended to use this for creating steel.
quest.tech.steel.netherrack.description_: Netherrack can only be found near portal ruins or volcanic biomes.
Strange how ruined portals exist, yet the Nether does not...
quest.tech.steel.nether_brick.descriptio: Smelt netherrack to obtain nether bricks.
quest.tech.steel.blast_brick.description: Craft blast bricks using nether bricks, regular bricks, and magma blocks.
quest.tech.steel.magma_block.description: Magma blocks can typically be found in underwater areas, near portal ruins, or in volcanic regions.
quest.tech.steel.blast_furnace.title: Blast Furnace
quest.tech.steel.blast_furnace.descripti: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a blast furnace under [Workbenches And Furnaces > Blast Furnace]
quest.tech.steel.ingot.title: Steel Ingot
quest.tech.steel.ingot.subtitle: Moving up the tech tree...
quest.tech.steel.ingot.description_1: Iron can be smelted into steel in the blast furnace using coke.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.squeezer.de: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a Squeezer under [Heavy Machinery > Squeezer]
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.plantoil.de: Obtain plant oil by squeezing plants in the Squeezer.
A list of squeezable plants can be found in the Engineer's Manual under [Heavy Machinery > Squeezer]
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.rubber_base: Mix plant oil and phenolic resin in a heated Create basin to create rubber base.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.phenolic_re: Refine Acetaldehyde with Creosote Oil in the Refinery to obtain Phenolic Resin.
Phenolic Resin is used in many materials, so be sure to keep a good stock!
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.refinery.de: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a squeezer under [Heavy Machinery > Refinery]
The Refinery is used for quite a few advanced materials, consider making one to handle each step of the process!
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.acetaldehyd: Refine ethanol into acetaldehyde in the Refinery using a silver plate as the catalyst.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.fermenter.s: Was there an alcohol recipe? I can't remember...
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.fermenter.d: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a Fermenter under [Heavy Machinery > Fermenter]
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.ethanol.des: Obtain ethanol by fermenting plants in the Fermenter.
A list of fermentable plants can be found in the Engineer's Manual under [Heavy Machinery > Fermenter]
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.duroplast.s: If Plastic is so good why didn't they make a Plastic 2-
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.duroplast.d: Obtain duroplast by bottling phenolic resin in a Bottling Machine using a Metal Press Mold:Plate.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.redstone_ac: Mix redstone dust and water to obtain redstone acid.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.rubber.desc: Mix rubber base and rubber base in a heated Create basin to create rubber.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.high_resist: Mix redstone acid and phenolic resin in a superheated Create basin to create high-resistance fiber.
Oh, while we're at it, we made Cloth 2, too
Mix high-resistance fiber and molten nethersteel in a superheated Create basin to create high-resistance fabric.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.molten_neth: Break nethersteel into nethersteel nuggets, then melt the nuggets in a heated Create basin with a Foundry Lid to create molten nethersteel.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.nethersteel: Mix netherite scrap and cast iron ingots in a superheated Create basin to create nethersteel.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.cast_iron_i: Uncraft a cast iron block to obtain cast iron ingots.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.cast_iron_b: Compact an iron block in a heated Create basin to create cast iron blocks.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.netherite_s: Netherite scrap can be obtained by looting.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.highcarbons: Obtain High-Carbon Steel Alloy by melting steel ingots, a block of coal coke, and netherite scrap in an Arc Furnace.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.arc_furnace: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create an arc furnace under [Heavy Machinery > Arc Furnace]
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.coal_coke_b: Craft coal coke into a block. This shouldn't be too hard.
quest.tech.power.introduction.title: The Industrial Age
quest.tech.power.introduction.subtitle: Power, Infinite Power!
quest.tech.power.introduction.descriptio: Both Create and Immersive Enginnering use different types of power, Stress Units (SU) and Forge Energy (FE). This section of the guide serves as an introduction to the methods of power generation available in both mods.
Make sure to consult the Engineer's Manual [Power,Wires,Generators > Power Generation] as well as use Create's ponder feature for more detailed descriptions.
quest.tech.power.motor.title: Electric Motor
quest.tech.power.motor.subtitle: FE > SU
quest.tech.power.motor.description_1: The motor allows for conversion of FE to SU. Ponder it for more information.
quest.tech.power.alternator.title: Electric Alternator
quest.tech.power.alternator.subtitle: SU > FE
quest.tech.power.alternator.description_: The alternator allows for conversion of SU to FE. Ponder it for more information.
quest.tech.power.steam_engine.title: Steam Engine
quest.tech.power.steam_engine.subtitle: Age of Steam
quest.tech.power.steam_engine.descriptio: The steam engine is Create's mid tier power generator, requiring a heat source and water.
Ponder the steam engine block for assembly instructions.
quest.tech.power.diesel.title: Diesel and Biodiesel
quest.tech.power.diesel.subtitle: A more efficient fuel
quest.tech.power.diesel.description_1: The more powerful generators in this modpack require either diesel or biodiesel as fuel.
quest.tech.power.diesel.description_2: Diesel can be refined from crude oil, which can be extracted using Create's Pumpjack. Be sure to ponder its blocks to learn how to set it up.
quest.tech.power.diesel.description_3: Biodiesel can be refined from ethanol and seed oil, which come from fermenting plants and crushing seeds.
quest.tech.power.diesel_generator.title: Diesel Generator
quest.tech.power.diesel_generator.descri: Immersive Enginnering's Diesel Generator is a multiblock structure that can be found in some buildings.
A detailed explanation of how to set it up can be found in the Engineer's Manual [Power,Wires,Generators > Diesel Generator].
quest.tech.power.diesel_engine.title: Diesel Engine
quest.tech.power.diesel_engine.descripti: The Diesel Engine is the lowest tier of Create's diesel generators. Fuel can be pumped into it from the bottom.
Make sure to ponder the block for assembly and usage instructions.
quest.tech.power.diesel_engine_modular.d: The Modular Diesel Engine is the middle tier of Create's diesel generators. Fuel can be pumped into it from the top.
Make sure to ponder the block for assembly and usage instructions.
quest.tech.power.diesel_engine_large.des: The Large Diesel Engine is the top tier Create diesel generator. Fuel can be pumped into it from the top.
Make sure to ponder the block for assembly and usage instructions.
quest.tech.power.engineer_goggles.title: Engineer's Goggles
quest.tech.power.engineer_goggles.subtit: The numbers... what do they mean?
quest.tech.power.engineer_goggles.descri: Creating and wearing a set of engineer's goggles will allow you to vizualise the Stress Units (SU) used and generated by your contraptions.
quest.tech.power.kinetic_dynamo.title: Kinetic Dynamo
quest.tech.power.kinetic_dynamo.subtitle: You spin me right round baby...
quest.tech.power.kinetic_dynamo.descript: Immersive Engineering's watermills and windmills have to be attached to a kinetic dynamo in order to generate power.
quest.tech.power.create_waterwheel.title: Water Wheel - Create
quest.tech.power.create_waterwheel.descr: Place waterwheels in flowing water to start generating power. Use shafts and cogs to move the power where you need it.
quest.tech.power.create_large_waterwheel: The large version of the waterwheel allows more power to be generated from flowing water.
quest.tech.power.immersive_waterwheel.de: Place waterwheels in flowing water to start generating power. Use wire connectors and wires attached to the kinetic dynamo to move the power where you need it.
quest.tech.power.create_windmill.title: Windmill - Create
quest.tech.power.create_windmill.descrip: Create's windmills require a windmill bearing. Craft and ponder it for more information.
quest.tech.power.create_windmill_sail.de: Windmill sails have to be attached to the windmill bearing. More sails will increase the amount of SU generated.
quest.tech.power.immersive_windmill.desc: Must be attached to a kinetic dynamo. Make sure to consult the Engineer's Manual [Power,Wires,Generators > Power Generation] for more information!
quest.tech.power.immersive_windmill_sail: Why did we make a windmill with holes anyways?
Windmill sails have to be attached to the windmill. More sails will increase the amount of SU generated.
quest.tech.power.thermoelectric_generato: Thermoelectric generators use the difference in tempreature of the two blocks opposite it to generate power.
A list of blocks that can be used can be found in the Engineer's Manual [Power,Wires,Generators > Thermoelectric Generator].
quest.tech.bullet_automation.subtitle: For advanced tech players.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.lava.title: Lava Source
quest.tech.bullet_automation.lava.descri: Lava should be easy enough to obtain, right?
quest.tech.bullet_automation.water.title: Water Source
quest.tech.bullet_automation.water.descr: Water is even easier to obtain.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.cobblestone: Create and automate a cobblestone generator.
An easy way is to do this with create drills.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.tree.title: Planting Trees
quest.tech.bullet_automation.tree.descri: Obtain any sapling and start planting trees.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.logs.title: Logs
quest.tech.bullet_automation.logs.subtit: Cut down trees with a mechanical saw.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.logs.descri: Consider automating this for power generation as well.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.charcoal.de: Create allows you to do this using encased fans and lava, make sure to ponder (W) on the entry for fans.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.blaze_rod.d: Blaze rods can be found by killing blazes in volcanic biomes.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.recycle_rod: Press blaze powder into blaze rods.
Craft or obtain a rod mold and use it in a press to convert blaze powder back into blaze rods,
quest.tech.bullet_automation.blaze_powde: Crush blaze rods into blaze powder.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.sulfur.subt: Crush blaze rods into sulfur dust.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.sulfur.desc: Sulfur is obtained as a byproduct of crushing blaze rods.
Alternatively, it can be mined from several types of mineral veins.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.assemble.de: Combine the bullet casing, lead nugget and gunpowder to make bullets.
To maximize the efficiency of bullet production, consider using a deployer, as they consume fewer resources.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.casings.sub: Press brass in a press with the bullet mold.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.lead_nugget: Obtain lead nuggets from lead bars.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.molds.title: Bullet Molds
quest.tech.bullet_automation.molds.subti: Find and loot a bullet mold.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.molds.descr: Obtain any bullet mold from factories in the wasteland.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.brass.subti: Combine zinc and copper to create brass.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.brass.descr: You can smelt the brass ingot using any of the following methods; it doesn't matter which one you choose.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.auricupride: Find and harvest auricupride for copper.
Find and harvest sphalerite for zinc.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.galena.desc: Find and harvest galena for lead.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.mineral_sur: Utilize the mineral survey tool to search for traces of mineral veins in the vicinity.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.excavator.d: Once you've located a suitable ore deposit, construct an excavator at that location.
Be warned, a massive amount of energy is required to run it!
quest.tech.bullet_automation.veins.title: Mineral Veins
quest.tech.bullet_automation.veins.descr: Information about all available mineral veins are listed in the Engineer's Manual. Refer to Overview and Resources > Mineral Deposits for detailed guidance.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.title: Fundamentals of Nuclear Physics
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.subtitle: Reinventing the Future
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.description: Even destroyed, the nuclear power plant in the wasteland provides a significant amount of reactor components... Perhaps it is time to try building your own?
The nuclear reactor and its turbines are the end-game power solution for Deceasedcraft. Its immense power output is one of the few things needed to restart the ruined laboratory portal.
However, acquiring the parts needed to assemble such a reactor is quite the challenge, and will likely require significant automation or exploration.
This guidebook will only go through the required parts a reactor will need - consider looking for guides online on how a reactor should be built!
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.uranium.des: Uranium is used as the fuel for the reactor, as well as a component for making the reactor fuel rod.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.aluminium.d: Aluminium plates are used to create machine casings, which are used to create the reactor casing, the primary block of the reactor.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.duroplast.d: Duroplast plates are used to create machine casings, which are used to create the reactor casing, the primary block of the reactor.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.steel_plate: Steel plates and rods are used to create many reactor and turbine components.
It is highly recommended to automate your steel production if you are planning to build the larger reactors.
Lead plates are used for reactor casings and control rods.
Like steel, It is highly recommended to automate your lead production if you are planning to build the larger reactors.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.graphite_el: Graphite electrodes are used for reactor control rods.
As they are also used in the Arc Furnace from Immersive Engineering, consider upgrading your smelting setup to take advantage of the increased ore yield.
quest.tech.nuclear.machine_casing.descri: Machine Casings are used to craft the reactor casing.
As they are also used for many Refined Storage components, consider automating this component!
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_fuel_rod.desc: A reactor needs at least one fuel rod, made of fuel rod blocks stretching from the floor to the ceiling.
The smallest reactor is a 3x3 cube, and has one fuel rod block in the center.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_casing.descri: A reactor's walls must be made of reactor casings.

The smallest reactor is a 3x3 cube, which consists of 21 casings, with spaces on the side for the reactor power tap, reactor controller and solid access port, and a space on the top for the reactor control rod.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_control_rod.d: Every fuel rod in the reactor must be capped on top with a control rod.
The smallest reactor is a 3x3 cube, and has one control rod block in the middle on top.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_solid_access_: The solid access port is the means by which uranium is inserted and waste is extracted from the reactor.
All reactors require a solid access port on one of its sides.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_controller.de: The reactor controller is the main control panel for the reactor.
All reactors require a reactor controller.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_active_power_: The active power tap is one of two ways to extract power from the reactor. It is best used with Immersive Engineering power cables.
Consider switching to the using other power tap if you cannot extract power from the reactor.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_passive_power: The passive power tap is one of two ways to extract power from the reactor. It is best used with pipez cables.
Consider switching to the using other power tap if you cannot extract power from the reactor.
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.title: Advanced Nuclear Physics
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.subtitle: But what if we wanted MORE power,,,?
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.description_1: To extract the maximum possible power from a nuclear reactor requires the construction of steam turbines.
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.description_2: However, due to their complexity, this guide will not go into detail about how to construct them.
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.description_3: It is recommended to look at guides or videos online on how turbines should be set up for optimum power production.
quest.tech.cannons.saw.title: Step 0: Moulding
quest.tech.cannons.saw.subtitle: Let's go Gambling!
quest.tech.cannons.saw.description_1: In order to begin making cannons or autocannons, you must first acquire the needed moulds by sawing logs with a mechanical saw.
quest.tech.cannons.saw.description_2: Once you have the moulds you can get more of the same by setting the filter on the saw, but initially the result will be random.
quest.tech.cannons.ac_breech.description: Every autocannon needs a breech at the back.
quest.tech.cannons.ac_recoil.description: Every autocannon needs a recoil spring in the middle, in front of the breech
quest.tech.cannons.ac_barrel.description: One part of three of the autocannon. Every autocannon needs at least one barrel, but can have more depending on how many the material can support.
quest.tech.cannons.cn_loader_end.descrip: The weakest of the loading mechanisms, a cap for the cannon that requires it to be loaded from the front.
Only available for cast iron cannons.
quest.tech.cannons.cn_loader_sliding.des: A medium strength loading mechanism that comes in a quick firing version that can be opened by hand.
Available for all cannons except nethersteel.
quest.tech.cannons.cn_loader_screw.descr: Only available for steel and nethersteel cannons.
quest.tech.cannons.cn_barrel.subtitle: Turns out, girth doesn't matter!
quest.tech.cannons.cn_barrel.description: The smallest cast for a cannon barrel. As barrel thickness does not affect strength, any larget barrel sizes are just for asthetics.
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_builder.descri: The cannon builder allows for stacking layers of cannon moulds together to form a thicker barrel. Be sure to Ponder [w] it for more details.
quest.tech.cannons.casting_sand.title: Step 1: Casting
quest.tech.cannons.casting_sand.subtitle: Avengers, assemble!
quest.tech.cannons.casting_sand.descript: Layers of casting sand need to be stacked and the moulds inserted to form the final shape of your cannon, and the desired material pumped into it afterwards.
As the cannon CANNOT be moved or changed by hand after it is cast, the entire cannon must be assembled in one go, with all necessary block moulds present.
Be sure to Ponder [w] the sand for more information, or search online for video guides.
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_drill.title: Step 2: Drilling
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_drill.subtitle: Drill go brrr...
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_drill.descript: The next step is boring a hole in the cannon. This requires mounting the cannon on a turntable, providing the drill with torque and water, as well as piston extension poles.
As with casting, be sure to Ponder [w] the drill for more information, or search online for video guides.
quest.tech.cannons.assembly.title: Step 2.5: Moving Parts
quest.tech.cannons.assembly.subtitle: It fell out...
quest.tech.cannons.assembly.description_: Some blocks like the sliding breech, screw breech, autocannon breech or autocannon recoil spring will require additional components to complete after being drilled.
quest.tech.cannons.fan.title: Step 3: Annealing
quest.tech.cannons.fan.subtitle: A fancy word for just cook it again.
quest.tech.cannons.fan.description_1: Cannon layers must be cooked into barrels by blowing lava over them with an encased fan. You can tell if the setup is correct if they start to smoke.
quest.tech.cannons.fan.description_2: Once this is complete, they will transform from layers to barrels or chambers automatically.
quest.tech.cannons.movement.title: Step 1.5: Moving Your Cannon
quest.tech.cannons.movement.subtitle: Time to test your Create knowledge...
quest.tech.cannons.movement.description_: Once casted, cannons cannot be moved by hand or broken. They must be moved around using Create's contraptions and mechanisms.
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_mount.title: Step 4: Mounting
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_mount.subtitle: Create(d) Big Cannons
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_mount.descript: Move the finished cannon onto a cannon mount. Once attached and activated with a lever, the cannon can be steered up and down using the shaft on the side and steered left and right using the shaft on the bottom.
Be sure to Ponder [w] the cannon mount for more information, or search online for video guides.
quest.tech.cannons.artillery.title: Heavy Artillery
quest.tech.cannons.artillery.subtitle: Calling down the Thunder
quest.tech.cannons.artillery.description: In order to fire your cannon, you will need to load shells into it. This guide will only go through the basics of making shells - it is recommended you check guides online for more effective ways to assemble cannons in general.
quest.tech.cannons.autocannon.title: Lead Rain
quest.tech.cannons.autocannon.subtitle: Gun go BRRRRT
quest.tech.cannons.autocannon.descriptio: In order to fire your autocannon, you will need to craft ammo containers, which will need to be loaded with shells. This guide will only go through the basics of making shells - it is recommended you check guides online for more effective ways to assemble cannons in general.
quest.tech.cannons.pump.description_1: Water needs to be pumped into the cannon drill while it is drilling.
quest.tech.cannons.lava.description_1: The encased fan needs to blow into lava to cook the cannon barrels.
quest.tech.cannons.cartridge.complete.de: Combine filled cartridges with a round of your choice.
quest.tech.cannons.ramhead.title: Loading and Removing Shells
quest.tech.cannons.ramhead.description_1: Shells and charges can be loaded by a ram and removed with a worm.
quest.tech.cannons.rod.title: Manual Loading
quest.tech.cannons.rod.description_1: Shells up to three blocks long can be manually loaded using the ram rod.
quest.tech.cannons.rod.description_2: Be sure to Ponder [w] the ram rod for more information!
quest.tech.cannons.loader.title: Automatic Loading
quest.tech.cannons.loader.description_1: A cannon loader is needed for shells longer than three blocks.
quest.tech.cannons.loader.description_2: Be sure to Ponder [w] the cannon loader for more information!
quest.tech.cannons.shells.description_1: There are many other types of cannon rounds - be sure to experiment to find out what works for you!
quest.tech.cannons.charges.description_1: At least one charge needs to be loaded behind a shell for the cannon to fire. The maximum depends on the strength of your cannon - too strong and it might explode, too weak and it might get stuck!
quest.tech.cannons.charges.description_2: You can check how many charges your cannon can withstand by looking at a cannon mount with an assembled cannon using enginner goggles.
quest.tech.radar.bearing.subtitle: Automated Aiming
quest.tech.radar.bearing.description_1: A radar allows you to automatically target and aim cannons at hostile targets.
quest.tech.radar.bearing.description_2: The radar itself must be built on top of a radar bearing and powered.
quest.tech.radar.reciever.description_1: Each radar must have one reciever. Place it on top of the bearing.
quest.tech.radar.dish.description_1: The radar's range can be extended using either radar plates or dishes attached to the reciever.
quest.tech.radar.dish.description_2: Both provide the same benefits and can be used interchangeably.
quest.tech.radar.datalink.subtitle: Sending Coordinates
quest.tech.radar.datalink.description_1: The data link allows for transfer of data from the radar to a monitor, and then to the pitch and yaw controllers. You will need to craft at least three.
quest.tech.radar.monitor.description_1: The monitor allows you to display all mobs within the radar's radius. You can extend it by connecting more monitors, so long as it is a square. (2x2,3x3, etc)
quest.tech.radar.monitor.description_2: Right click on the monitor with a data link, then shift right click on the radar bearing to bind the radar to the monitor.
quest.tech.radar.yawcontroller.descripti: The yaw controller automatically controls the yaw of a cannon. It should be placed on the bottom of the cannon mount and provided with torque.
Right click on a monitor with a data link, then shift right click on the yaw controller to bind the monitor to the controller.
quest.tech.radar.pitchcontroller.descrip: The pitch controller automatically controls the pitch of a cannon. It should be placed on the side of the cannon mount and provided with torque.
Right click on a monitor with a data link, then shift right click on the pitch controller to bind the monitor to the controller.
